reviews.review: 这个游戏很酷

I've finished this game probably half a dozen times, it's that good.

The story is amazing and the difficulty of the levels ramps up nicely. You always feel challenged, but never out of your league. I love how the game throws you through different time periods on different literal layers of Aperture Science, from the overgrown dystopian top, to the familiar Portal 1-esque crisp, clean white middle, down to the dusty brown of the 70s, then back up to the crisp whiteness. 

Absolutely worth every single dollar.

[h1][b]That Cake is a Lie.[/b][/h1]

“终身测试计划”现已升级
加入双人模式，让你不再一人独享蛋糕。
------------------
无处不在的简洁和自然。
在保留核心玩法的情况下加入了很多有趣的解谜元素，大大增加了游戏的可能性，使整个流程更加丰富。
在主线解密的同时，如果善于寻找和探索，有相当分量的彩蛋和隐藏内容等待着玩家去发掘，有些是壁上涂鸦，有些则是剧情细节的补充。
本作相对于前作，剧情得到了强化。解谜过程中听听两个机器人的对话很有趣，两个机器人的对话成功塑造出这两个角色的鲜明个性，并以其独特的声音有了更多感染力，让玩家很难去忽略这个简单的剧情。
------------------
曾经你杀了我，而我Still Alive.
如今你回来了，我却Want you gone.


[h1]最后，谁来教教G胖数3[/h1]
A very well executed sequel to an excellent game. This game did what the original did but even better which isn't something you always see from a sequel.

Short, but just long enough, with a fantastic story. I normally value atmosphere way more than story in a game, and like most of it to be left to the imagination. But this is a rare case where the story is beneficial to the game. Up there with the best stories, even if relatively simple. 

Puzzles are on the easy side (haven't tried bonus content thus far). Did get tripped up a couple times, but not enough to need to refer to a guide (enough to come back later for just a couple). 

Stellar writing, continuity, voice acting.

OIGAN GILES DONDE ESTA EL 3

This was a tough one to review. Portal 2 has gained nearly universal priase for its fantastic gameplay. As a huge fan of the original game, I was thrilled when I booted up Portal 2 for the first time. The game starts out very strong, and has a much better pace than the original Portal game in terms of story. The game itself has a more fleshed out story than Portal 1, but personally, I don't think that this is fitting for the game. To me, Portal's emphasis was more on the gameplay then it was on story. However, the voice acting is phenomenal. Whether it's Wheatley or GladOS, the voice acting is brilliant. The puzzles themselves are great, but I never had a problem completing them. I mean sure, sometime I had to think about what I had to do, but never did I struggle with any of the puzzles. The original Portal was an amazing innovation to gaming. Portal 2 is more of the same. Portal 2 is a harder game to reccomend over Portal 1, but because it isn't a demo length game, probably worth more then the original. Portal 2 gets an 8.5/10.
